question: If Fiona sold 11 apples and then sold 7 mangoes, how many fruits did she sell in total?
Ben baked 15 brownies and 4 cookies. How many items did he bake altogether?
If Alice painted 12 pictures of fruits and then painted 6 more, how many fruit-themed pictures did she paint in total?
Fiona had 24 oranges on her stall and she received 13 more from the market delivery. How many oranges does Fiona have now?
Ben made 37 pastries for the market, and he baked 22 more. How many pastries did Ben make in total?
If Fiona has 40 apples and Ben has 20 muffins, how many items do they have together?
Ben had 28 loaves of bread, and he baked 11 more during the day. How many loaves of bread does Ben have now?
Alice had 31 paintings displayed, and she added 14 more paintings. How many paintings does Alice have in total?
If Fiona saw 37 customers at her stall, and 42 more came by, how many customers visited her stall?
Ben had 53 cupcakes, and he decorated 32 more. How many cupcakes does Ben have now?
